for_sales.sales_text:
Tantina II

Above deck Equipment

Bicolour bow light 

SL electric anchor windlass – 85 metres of 3/8th in calibrated chain – 35 lb CQR anchor – additional 5/16th in chain and Danforth type anchor as kedge.  100m of 16mm nylon warp on plastic drum.

Assorted mooring lines and warps.

Harken furling system for headsail

Removeable inner forestay

Proctor alloy mast, boom with 3 slab reefing lines and twin spinnaker poles.  2 manual halliard winches and 3 rope jammer units on mast for each winch

Masthead tricolour/anchor light with LED bulbs

Hawk wind direction and VHF aerial and wind units for B & G and Raymarine wind instruments.

Spreader mounted deck lights

Sprayhood with zipped cockpit canopy (new 2018)

Mainsail lazyjacks and stackpak 

2 Lewmar 40 genoa sheet winches and 2 Lewmar spinnaker sheet winches in cockpit

B & G and Raymarine sailing instruments in cockpit plus echo sounder display 

Autohelm SPX5 grand prix autopilot and reserve Autohelm 2000

Sestrel Moore compass mounted on hatch garage.

2 Solar panels on sliding mount aft of cockpit – deck mounted seat with 6-person canister liferaft stowed below seat.

GME 406Mhz/121Mhz EPIRB

Two horseshoe lifebuoys on guardrail holders

Hydrovane wind powered self-steering gear.

Avon Redcrest dinghy with 2 hp outboard motor, pump, oars, floorboards plus electric inflation pump.

Electric drill wired to run from ships batteries.

Below deck

Forecabin with two berths.  Water tank under each with additional storage.  Lewmar Ocean hatch.

Toilet/shower compartment

Toilet to starboard with electric/manual Lavac toilet.

Wash basin to port with hot and cold pressurised water.  Shower with auto electric discharge.  Blakes seacocks (3) for toilet etc.

Main saloon

Clock and barometer

Bunks/seats port and starboard with table between.

Batteries – Three AGM sealed 85ah below cabin floor.

Eberspacher diesel heater outlets in both main and shower areas.

Sony cd/radio with two speakers

Chart table to starboard with nav instruments, including Furuno Radar, Furuno Differential GPS, Simrad VHF (linked to radar), Raymarine plotter and AIS, Echo sounder.  Echomax dual band radar target enhancer control. Gas alarm control ( waterproof sensor mounted in bilge). Bilge alarm control. B & G multi function display.  BEP marine switch panel with 24 circuit breakers. Quarter berth under chart table with 3rd water tank underneath. C-Tek 200 Marine battery chgarger.

Galley to port with two burner, grill and oven gas cooker.  Built in fridge.  Sink with pressurised and manual hot and cold water.  Calorifier for hot water mounted under cockpit floor with immersion 240v heater for use with shore power. 

Engine compartment forms steps to cockpit.  Engine is Beta BD722 20hp with PRM 80 gearbox.  (Spare alternative ratio gearbox included) coupled to Aquadrive shaft coupling and 3 blade feathering Kiwiprop.

Internal lighting is by individual light units specially fitted with both white and red led bulbs.  Red/white lighting is switched by separate circuits from the BEP panel.  

Sails

Main, genoa and storm jib by Saturn sails all in good order plus various other sails including larger storm jib and staysail.  Two spinnakers, one in snuffer.

Sprayhood for cockpit plus easily removeable fully enclosing cockpit canopy. 

Short description

Tantina 2

Built R.A.Newman, Poole in 1961

Designed by J. Francis Jones

LOA 31ft 7in

Beam 8ft 3in

Draft 5ft 6in

Designed Displacement 5.25 tons 

Designed to fit both JOG and RORC rules, she is both fast and seaworthy.  Owned by the same owner for 40 years and maintained without regard to cost. Wintered ashore inside each year.

ORC Cat 1 (Long offshore races without possibility of outside assistance) 

Construction

Pitch pine and mahogany planking on oak frames.  Teak decks and superstructure.

Lead keel, bronze keel bolts.

Deck stepped alloy mast and boom.

Stainless standing rigging.

boat.full_description:
Designed by J. Francis Jones and beautifully built by R. A. Newman in 1961.  Her design as a cruiser/racer appeared as a centrefold in Yachting World the same year. In the same ownership for the last 40 years, she has been maintained on a no expense spared basis and always kept indoors during the winter. Very strongly built with pitch pine and mahogany planking on oak frames with teak decks and superstructure. Lead keel, bronze keel bolts. 

A very capable cruiser, having been as far north as Shetland Islands, west as far as Rockall, and south to France, Brittany, and Azores.
boat.name: Tantina II
boat.short_description: Featured in Yachting World as a good cruiser that can race under JOG/RORC rules, Tantina II is heavily built and survived a Force 11 at Rockall. She has cruised from France to Shetlands and as far as The Azores.
